|Title=Know the definition of encephalic death
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dany Anglicheau
|Order=6}}

Encephalic death is the definitive and irreversible destruction of the brain.

It corresponds to a deep, reactive coma, with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing.

question.question: What is encephalic death?
question.option_a: A condition characterized by a persistent vegetative state with no brain activity
question.option_b: A state of deep, reactive coma with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing
question.option_c: A condition that occurs when the brain is under anesthesia for an extended period
question.option_d: A state of deep, non-reactive coma with preservation of some brain stem reflexes
